fields.headline: Changing Lanes by Fay Musselwhite
fields.bodyText: Sunny day jangles, Blurring recently familiar rural lanes And green idyllic woolly plains. Fluent now round these Unchevronned long deceptive bends. Bare back seat, no chair, No song or 'Are we nearly there.' Clearer view now Of the road behind. Severn glints alluringly - Keep driving - Like a week ago. Last time I saw you. In this foreign land Resolve steps up a gear. We'll learn to do things different here. Crops combined and planned On land long understood. Snug established homes, Cosy rosy anchored And preserved. In a passing lane A mother holds Her daughter's hand. Destination southern city. Signposts blur then clarify Then blur again. Signalling potential for direction, Indicating need to get in lane. Nearly there, yet Barely passed a junction on The long road back to you.
